![Community Spotlight | Thibaut Segura](https://storage.googleapis.com/papyrus_images/b69c02f2d0c1930f7a27152cf8d4b57875e9e83b0c3410badb02cba9c74c4075.jpg)

<p>Did you know that Unlock DAO is a decentralized autonomous organization that governs the actual protocol? These are ordinary people, like you, making decisions about the protocol and its future development in a decentralized manner, using the&nbsp;<a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow ugc" class="dont-break-out" href="https://docs.unlock-protocol.com/governance/unlock-dao/">$UP token as the governance currency</a>. DAO Members propose new ideas through proposals and vote on them to help the protocol be future-proof. However, aside from DAO Members, we also have DAO Contributors, Ambassadors, and Stewards. These members have dedicated additional resources and time to the ever-evolving future of Unlock Protocol.</p><p>Today, it is my pleasure to introduce you to <strong>Thibaut Segura</strong>, aka <strong>TheDesignIconoclast</strong>, one of our newest members who joined us with a mission.</p><hr><h2 id="h-who-is-thedesigniconoclast" class="text-3xl font-header !mt-8 !mb-4 first:!mt-0 first:!mb-0"><strong>Who is TheDesignIconoclast?</strong></h2><p>One day, about four weeks ago, a new member showed up in the Unlock Discord and introduced himself as <strong>TheDesignIconoclast</strong>. Naturally, as a designer myself, I got curious, and upon my invitation, he joined our weekly DAO debate. In case you didn't know, it is not rare for new people to show up in the Unlock Discord or even at the DAO Calls, but what stands out are people who come with a plan. Precisely that was the case with TheDesignIconoclast, aka&nbsp;<a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow ugc" class="dont-break-out" href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/thibautsegura/"><strong>Thibaut Segura</strong></a><strong>.</strong></p><p>With a strong background in design and user-centric development work for the past 15 years, he has put his primary focus on user adoption. Now that he has joined the world of Web3 development equipped with the right tech skills (Solidity + React), he is set on creating a positive and long-lasting impact. Looking for projects with real-life impact is what drew him to Unlock Protocol and made him join a DAO Call a few weeks ago, suggesting a new integration that will specifically make certifications with Unlock even more attractive to users.</p><p>Segura is clearly a new wave of cross-disciplinary builders combining <strong>design, technical execution, and decentralized identity</strong> principles to create user-centric blockchain products. In my personal opinion, exactly what this space needs right now.</p><hr><h2 id="h-the-project-idea" class="text-3xl font-header !mt-8 !mb-4 first:!mt-0 first:!mb-0"><strong>The Project Idea</strong></h2><p>While Thibaut was looking for aligned protocols that thought about real-life use cases, he came across Unlock. He was positively surprised that we were not the next tech project trying to optimize latency or TPS (transactions per second). Apparently, he connected immediately with what the protocol provides and what <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow ugc" class="dont-break-out" href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/juliengenestoux/"><strong>Julien</strong></a>, <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow ugc" class="dont-break-out" href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/clementrenaud/"><strong>Cl√©ment</strong></a>, <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow ugc" class="dont-break-out" href="https://github.com/0xTxbi"><strong>Txbi</strong></a>, and <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow ugc" class="dont-break-out" href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/ccarfi/"><strong>CCarfi</strong> </a>had been putting so much attention towards over the years: A <strong>simple UI</strong>, the <strong>avoidance of jargon</strong>, and most of all, tying the tech with <strong>real-life problem solving</strong>. Or to quote his own words:</p><blockquote><h3 id="h-unlock-is-the-kind-of-project-you-want-to-see-succeed-because-it-can-quietly-change-a-whole-industry-for-the-better" class="text-2xl font-header !mt-6 !mb-4 first:!mt-0 first:!mb-0"><strong>"Unlock is the kind of project you want to see succeed because it can quietly change a whole industry, for the better."</strong></h3></blockquote><p>At the same time, he saw an opportunity to improve the protocol even further by tackling the Certification flow. Currently, the certifier (e.g., a university) cannot make the certificate specific to the student (e.g., have their name, age, grades, thesis, etc., show up).&nbsp;</p><p>This is where he formed the connection and how the Ethereum Attestation Service (also an open-source protocol) could become part of the current certification flow at Unlock and allow certifiers to create attestations that are additionally verifiable on-chain.</p><p>This would make for a truly enhanced certification flow, providing the certifier with two options:</p><ul><li><p><strong>Basic:</strong> Pure NFT with only the certifier information</p></li><li><p><strong>Premium:</strong> Attestation, containing student-specific data. Easy to share and easy to verify.</p></li></ul><p>With his previous work in Web3, Thibaut had a chance to work with the <strong>Ethereum Attestation Service (EAS)</strong> for tenant reliability verification. For this specific project, each on-time rent payment generates an onchain attestation, creating a privacy-preserving and portable record of trust between tenants and landlords. This project illustrates his capability to create a handy integration for Unlock Protocol with EAS.</p><hr><h2 id="h-support-the-idea-via-giveth" class="text-3xl font-header !mt-8 !mb-4 first:!mt-0 first:!mb-0"><strong>Support the Idea via Giveth</strong></h2><p>If you believe, as I do, that this idea is brilliant and will level up your and all of our users' experience with Unlock, please ensure to <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow ugc" class="dont-break-out" href="https://giveth.io/project/unlock-protocol-certification-boost-with-eas">support the project</a> via the current Giveth round (until the 28th of October). <strong>Any support matters, monetary or by sharing this article on socials and tagging Unlock as well as Thibaut:</strong></p><figure float="none" data-type="figure" class="img-center" style="max-width: null;"><a href="https://giveth.io/project/unlock-protocol-certification-boost-with-eas" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow ugc" style="cursor: pointer;"><img src="/images/blog/community-spotlight---thibaut-segura/9c2c1932a14d4a47d4683e1e1d983ff23c96e27b51c25148b36db1b156c02147.png" blurdataurl="data:image/png;base64," nextheight="828" nextwidth="1110" class="image-node embed"></a><figcaption htmlattributes="[object Object]" class="hide-figcaption"></figcaption></figure><hr><h2 id="h-get-in-touch-with-thedesigniconoclast" class="text-3xl font-header !mt-8 !mb-4 first:!mt-0 first:!mb-0"><strong>Get in Touch with TheDesignIconoclast</strong></h2><p>I believe this is not the last we hear from Thibaut. He is driven, organized, and comes with a needed mix of skills in Web3! If you want to keep tabs on his story, feel free to connect and follow him through his favorite channels:</p><ul><li><p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow ugc" class="dont-break-out" href="https://x.com/theDesignMojo">X</a></p></li><li><p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow ugc" class="dont-break-out" href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/thibautsegura">LinkedIn</a></p></li><li><p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow ugc" class="dont-break-out" href="https://github.com/toosolid2003">Github</a></p></li><li><p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow ugc" class="dont-break-out" href="https://www.segura.build/">Portfolio</a></p></li></ul><hr><h2 id="h-stay-unlocked" class="text-3xl font-header !mt-8 !mb-4 first:!mt-0 first:!mb-0"><strong>Stay Unlocked!</strong></h2><p>Your Steward for Operations &amp; Coordination,<br>Stella <span data-name="sparkles" class="emoji" data-type="emoji"><img src="/images/blog/community-spotlight---thibaut-segura/2728.png" draggable="false" loading="lazy" align="absmiddle"></span></p><hr><h2 id="h-want-to-get-spotlighted" class="text-3xl font-header !mt-8 !mb-4 first:!mt-0 first:!mb-0"><strong>Want to get Spotlighted?</strong></h2><p>Are you part of the Unlock Protocol DAO, or have you built something with the protocol? We would love to feature you and your project to expose it to a larger audience! Fill out <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow ugc" class="dont-break-out" href="https://app.deform.cc/form/5ccdfd5d-5907-4711-bd12-4d7b6cc277a2"><strong>this form </strong></a>to apply, and you may just be selected. To maintain complete transparency, we only release one spotlight per month.</p><hr><h2 id="h-join-us" class="text-3xl font-header !mt-8 !mb-4 first:!mt-0 first:!mb-0"><strong>Join Us</strong></h2><ul><li><p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow ugc" class="dont-break-out" href="https://x.com/UnlockProtocol"><strong>X</strong></a></p></li><li><p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow ugc" class="dont-break-out" href="https://www.tiktok.com/@unlock.dao?_t=ZT-8sqNLXE6lfn&amp;_r=1"><strong>Tik Tok</strong></a></p></li><li><p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow ugc" class="dont-break-out" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/unlock-protocol-dao/"><strong>LinkedIn</strong></a></p></li><li><p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow ugc" class="dont-break-out" href="https://www.youtube.com/@UnlockProtocol%20Farcaster%20Account%20%7C%20https://warpcast.com/unlock-protocol"><strong>YouTube</strong></a></p></li><li><p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow ugc" class="dont-break-out" href="https://farcaster.xyz/unlock-protocol"><strong>Farcaster</strong></a></p></li></ul><br>
